args: Sylas, can you use this flower?
Yes, please collect that one as well.\n*sigh* I'm sorry for dragging you\nalong just to pick plants.
I appreciate you saying that, Prince.\nLuca, you ought follow your liege's\nexample and work hard.
And yet, I recall a time long ago when you\nmerely pretended to help while gathering\nmushrooms for use in some prank.
You mean back when we were kids and I\ncame to stay in your village? Aaah ha ha!\nYeah, I remember that. Good times.
Say, speaking of the old days,\nhow's your grandpa doin'?
He was the one who taught you\nall about aromatic stuff, yeah?
I fear my grandfather fell victim to a grave\nillness and passed on some time ago.
Oh, man. Sorry to hear that.
It's all right. He lived a good... Hmm?
What's wrong, little girl?\nAre you all alone out here?
I was picking flowers, and then...
Got lost, huh? Well, she's gotta be from\none of the nearby villages, so let's figure\nout which one and get her home.
Everything's going to be all right.
*sniff* Thanks, mister.\nI'll give you one of my yellow flowers.
Why, thank you. Is it your favorite kind?
My gramma likes 'em, so I'm gonna\nbring her a whoooole bunch!
That's a very kind thought, but walking\naround the woods alone is dangerous.
From now on, you should only gather\nflowers with your gramma. All right?
But she can't go out in the woods\n'cause she's really sick.
So were these flowers a get-well\npresent, then?
...Nothing. Let us see the child home.
Oh, thank you so much for bringing\nmy daughter home safe!
We only did what anyone would do.
Mama, I went to pick flowers for gramma!\nDid I get it right this time?
My mother has a treasured memory of\na field of yellow flowers. I fear it's made\nquite the impression on my daughter.
She keeps bringing her all manner of\nyellow flowers, but can't seem to find\nthe exact right ones.
I know gramma will feel better if\nshe sees her special flower!
And where exactly was this field located?
Hmm. I believe she was traveling across\nthe southern part of the continent...\nMaybe in a forest somewhere?
Yellow flowers in a forest to the south...
(If that's true, the child will never find\nthe flower she seeks in this climate.)
I'm sorry, but my mother has awakened\nand I need to attend to her.
Of course. We'll be going now.
Oh, and please come tell me if you find\nthe flower my gramma likes, okay?
We shall do so at once.
Oh man, I'm so hungry I can't even sleep!\nThink I'll just grab me some munchies\nfrom the ol' kitchen and... Um...
Why is the light on in Sylas's room?
All right, that's all the essential oils.\nNow to carefully begin compounding...
This have something to do with that\nflower kid we met this afternoon?
Gya! Luca! Are your knuckles broken,\nor were you merely too rude to knock?!
I did knock! A lot, actually. You were just\nso wrapped up in that kid's flower business\nyou didn't notice. Make any progress?
We don't have a lot to go on, but I would\nsurmise the flower she seeks does not\nbloom in this area at all.
So gramma won't get to see her flower?\nMan, that's rough.
Worry not; I have a plan that will let her\nexperience it again all the same.
Well, so long as you're burnin' the\nmidnight oil, you might as well take this.
An apple? You know I prefer strawberries.
Don't push it, bud. This was all I could\nfind in the pantry.
And yet you thought to sneak off with it!\nHonestly, you ARE a troublemaker.
However, seeing as how I am a bit\npeckish, I will accept your offer.
The next day, Luca and Sylas once again\npay a visit to the young girl's home.
Oh! Did you find gramma's flower?!
Sorry, kid, but no dice. However,\nwe DID bring somethin' else good...
Mother? You have guests—and they've\nbrought you a little surprise.
I know you seek a flower you once saw\nlong ago, madam. Alas, though I tried,\nI fear I cannot provide that for you.
However, I believe this aromatic could\nat least permit you to enjoy their scent.
I had a rough idea of the flower you saw,\nand replicated its scent with an aromatic.\nHow do you find it?
I can see exactly how the field looked\nthat day... Even my husband is there!
He asked for my hand in that field,\nand I gladly gave it to him. Oh ho ho!
It's been ages since I've seen my mother\nso lively and full of energy!
I am pleased to have brought her this\nsmall joy. And with that, we will be off.
Wow, Sylas. Your aromatics really helped\nthat lady perk up.
And yet, while it may have given her the\nstrength to face her illness for a short\nwhile, it cured nothing.
I must finish my healing aromatic\nfor that poor woman's sake!
Hey, so what's the deal with this healing\naromatic of yours anyway? Why are you\nso freakin' obsessed with it?
He battled against his illness until his\nabsolute final moment, and in doing so,\nsuffered as no man should.
Only the smell of my aromatics could\ngrant him a moment's respite.
That's when I started thinking about\nimproving my craft.
Think how much better it would be if\nmy art could heal as well as soothe!
Then no one would have to suffer\nas my grandfather did.
Wow, man. That's some heavy stuff.
But now that I've heard it, I'm gonna do\nwhatever I can to see your dream\nbecome a reality!
Oh, this is no mere dream, Luca.\nIt is an act I will absolutely accomplish.
